org.wikipedia.miner.util
Class MarkupStripper

java.lang.Object
  org.wikipedia.miner.util.MarkupStripper

public class MarkupStripper
extends java.lang.Object

This provides tools to strip out markup from wikipedia articles, or anything else that has been written in mediawiki's format. It's all pretty simple, so don't expect perfect parsing.

Author:
David Milne

Method Detail

stripEverything

public static java.lang.String stripEverything(java.lang.String markup)
Strips a string of all markup; tries to turn it into plain text

Parameters:
markup - the text to be stripped
Returns:
the stripped text

stripLinks

public static java.lang.String stripLinks(java.lang.String markup)
Strips all links from the given markup; anything like [[this]] is replaced. If it is a link to a wikipedia article, then it is replaced with its anchor text. If it is a link to anything else (category, translation, etc) then it is removed completely.

Parameters:
markup - the text to be stripped
Returns:
the stripped text

stripNonArticleLinks

public static java.lang.String stripNonArticleLinks(java.lang.String markup)
Strips all non-article links from the given markup; anything like [[this]] is removed unless it goes to a wikipedia article, redirect, or disambiguation page.

Parameters:
markup - the text to be stripped
Returns:
the stripped text

stripTemplates

public static java.lang.String stripTemplates(java.lang.String markup)
Strips all templates from the given markup; anything like {{this}}.

Parameters:
markup - the text to be stripped
Returns:
the stripped text

stripTables

public static java.lang.String stripTables(java.lang.String markup)
Strips all tables from the given markup; anything like {|this|}.

Parameters:
markup - the text to be stripped
Returns:
the stripped text

stripRefs

public static java.lang.String stripRefs(java.lang.String markup)
Strips all tags from the given markup; both those that provide links to footnotes, and the footnotes themselves.

Parameters:
markup - the text to be stripped
Returns:
the stripped text

stripHTML

public static java.lang.String stripHTML(java.lang.String markup)
Strips all html tags and comments from the given markup. Text found between tags is not removed.

Parameters:
markup - the text to be stripped
Returns:
the stripped text

stripExternalLinks

public static java.lang.String stripExternalLinks(java.lang.String markup)
Strips all links to external web pages; anything like [this] that starts with "http" or "www".

Parameters:
markup - the text to be stripped
Returns:
the stripped text

stripFormatting

public static java.lang.String stripFormatting(java.lang.String markup)
Strips all wiki formatting, the stuff that makes text bold, italicised, intented, listed, or made into headers.

Parameters:
markup - the text to be stripped
Returns:
the stripped text

stripExcessNewlines

public static java.lang.String stripExcessNewlines(java.lang.String markup)
Collapses consecutive newlines into at most two newlines. This is provided because stripping out templates and tables often leaves large gaps in the text.

Parameters:
markup - the text to be stripped
Returns:
the stripped text

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
Provides a demo of MarkupStripping

Parameters:
args - an array of arguments for connecting to a wikipedia datatabase: server and database names at a minimum, and optionally a username and password
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - if there is a problem with the wikipedia database.
